intro: Agave ananassoides, commonly known as the pineapple agave, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped foliage composed of thick, waxy, blue-green leaves that are often adorned with sharp spines. The plant produces a tall, branched inflorescence that bears small, yellowish-green flowers. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it well-suited for arid environments. Its unique appearance and ability to store water in its leaves make it a popular choice for xeriscaping and ornamental gardening.
